events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving a collision with a tree, causing significant damage to the front bumper and windshield.
The claim has been classified under the Auto Accident category after verifying the initial report details and involved vehicle information.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and will coordinate further communications with the customer and service providers.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured timely updates regarding the next steps.
The customer was asked to submit police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driverâ€™s license to proceed with the investigation.
All requested documents, including accident photographs and the official police report, were submitted by the customer within the deadline.
The claims investigation team initiated the review of submitted documents and contacted the repair shop for vehicle damage assessment.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of claim validity and assessment report confirming repair costs and damage extent.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the estimated vehicle repair costs minus applicable deductibles.
The customer replied expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and requested to proceed with payment issuance.
The claim was formally approved by the underwriting department after all conditions were verified and met.
Settlement funds were disbursed to the customer's bank account to cover the vehicle repairs in accordance with the approved amount.
The claim has been officially closed following successful payment and confirmation that repairs were completed without further issues.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived in the system as per company data retention policies and for future reference.
